issue.title: Python: Account for library versioning in parquet-cpp
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1030](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1030). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
parquet-cpp also has versioned shared libraries. While `auditwheel` handles them transparantly, `delocate` cannot cope with them.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1030?focusedCommentId=16009850) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
This is something that should be in the release but I guess it's quite easy to fix. Holding off with the parquet-cpp release to check if all pre-requests are fulfilled there.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1030?focusedCommentId=16011310) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Does this need to block 0.4.0 RC?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1030?focusedCommentId=16011387) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Yes. But after the (already merged) patch, this is a very small change. Will do tomorrow morning.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1030?focusedCommentId=16014292) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 698
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/698>
